snippet: The Obama administration is considering reining in many N.S.A. practices overseas, but for now, officials have concluded that there is no workable alternative to the collection of huge quantities of “metadata.”
abstract: Obama administration has told allies and lawmakers that it is considering reigning in a variety of National Security Agency practices overseas, but has concluded that there is no workable alternative to the bulk collection of huge quantities of 'metadata,' including records of all telephone calls made inside the United States.
lead_paragraph: The Obama administration is considering reining in many N.S.A. practices overseas, but for now, officials have concluded that there is no workable alternative to the collection of huge quantities of “metadata.”

headline.main: As U.S. Weighs Spying Changes, Officials Say Data Sweeps Must Continue
headline.print_headline: As U.S. Weighs Spying Changes, Officials Say Data Sweeps Must Continue
